org.team4159.boths

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team4159.boths.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    Base class of the BotHS framework.

    NOTE: The FRC cRIO already has a web service running on port 80. Using port 80 will result in an error as the port has already been allocated.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Vector routes
      URL routes to match paths to while dealing with requests.

    • Constructor Summary

      Initializes an Server instance on port 8080.

      Initializes an Server instance on a given port.
      Server(int port, int numberOfWorkerThreads)
      Initializes a Server instance on a given port with a set number of worker threads.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server()
        Initializes an Server instance on port 8080.

      • Server

        public Server(int port)
        Initializes an Server instance on a given port.
        Parameters:
        port - The TCP port the server will run on.

      • Server

        public Server(int port,
      int numberOfWorkerThreads)
        Initializes a Server instance on a given port with a set number of worker threads. Increasing the number of worker threads will increase concurrency at the expense of system resources.
        Parameters:
        port - The TCP port the server will run on.
        numberOfWorkerThreads - The number of worker threads to create.

    • Method Detail

      • setPort

        public void setPort(int port)
        Sets the number of the TCP port the server will run on.

        Do not call this method while the server is running.

        Parameters:
        port - The TCP port the server will run on.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Gets the number of the TCP port the server will run on.
        Returns:
        The TCP port the server will run on.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Checks if the server is currently running.
        Returns:
        true if the server is currently running, false otherwise.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the server.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the server.

      • run

        public void run()
        Implementation of Thread.run() for request handler.

        Do not call this method directly. Instead, call start(), which will start the request handling loop in the background.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
